actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

official_title: A bill to amend the Communications Act of 1934 to require that communications services be more universally available and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require the Federal Communications Commission to ensure that interstate and intrastate telecommunications relay services are available to hearing-impaired and speech-impaired individuals in the United States. Requires every common carrier to provide such telecommunications relay services individually or through designees or in concert with other carriers within two years after enactment of this Act. Directs the Commission to adopt regulations to implement this Act.
